alert.note: Alert for Brown; Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:49AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, northern Shawnee, northeastern Douglas, northeastern Pottawatomie, Nemaha, Jackson and Brown Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 149 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Centralia to 3 miles northeast of Lawrence. Movement was east at 90 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Topeka, northern Lawrence, Holton, Hiawatha, Sabetha, Seneca, Horton, Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, St. Marys, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Hoyt, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Lecompton, Winchester, Centralia and Wetmore. This includes Kansas Turnpike near mile marker 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee
